Argon-aframe — Lesson 6: Geolocation

Determining the user’s location and placing a object in a geolocation near the user.

The <ar-geopose> primitive creates an entity with a referenceframe component that defines the position and/or rotation of the entity by an LLA (longitude, lattitude, altitude).
The userotation and useposition properties can be set to true (the default) to have this entity set it’s rotation and/or position from the referenceframe. Often, the position is used but the rotation may be left to be specified in the local coordinates.
